attention1.ptxt: When performing the following procedure, be sure to observe Precautions on Fuel System Service:M16A and J20A to reduce the risk of fire and personal injury.

s1.ptxt: Relieve fuel pressure in fuel feed line.
Disconnect fuel feed hose from fuel delivery pipe.
Connect special tools between fuel feed hose (1) and fuel delivery pipe as shown in figure, and clamp hoses securely to ensure that no leaks occur during checking.
Check that battery voltage is 11 V or more.

s2.ptxt: Turn ignition switch to ON position to operate fuel pump.
Repeat step a) and b) three or four times, and then check fuel pressure.

spec.title: Fuel pressure specification
spec.ptxt: (With fuel pump operating and engine stopped)

s2.ptxt: If measured pressure is out of specification, repair or replace defective part.

s1.ptxt: Remove special tools from fuel delivery pipe and fuel feed hose.
Connect fuel feed hose to fuel delivery pipe and clamp it securely.
With engine stationary and ignition in switch ON position, check for fuel leaks.

attention1.ptxt: When performing the following procedure, be sure to observe Precautions on Fuel System Service:M16A and J20A in order to reduce the risk or fire and personal injury.

s1.ptxt: Relieve fuel pressure in fuel feed line referring to Fuel Pressure Relief Procedure:M16A and J20A .
Disconnect fuel feed hose from fuel delivery pipe.
Connect special tools and hose between fuel feed hose (1) and fuel delivery pipe as shown in the figure, and clamp hoses securely in order to ensure that no leaks occur during checking.
Check that battery voltage is 11 V or more.
Measure fuel pressure at each condition.
If measured pressure is out of specification, refer to Fuel Pressure Check:M16A and J20A and check each possibly defective part. Replace if found defective.

s2.ptxt: Turn ignition switch ON to operate fuel pump and after 2 seconds turn it OFF. Repeat this 3 or 4 times and then check fuel pressure.

spec.title: Fuel pressure specification with fuel pump operating and engine stopped

s2.ptxt: Start engine and warm it up to normal operating temperature, and measure fuel pressure at idling.

spec.title: Fuel pressure specification at specified idle speed

s2.ptxt: Stop engine, and measure fuel pressure at one minute after stopping.

spec.title: Fuel pressure specification in 1 min. after engine (fuel pump) stop (Pressure reduces as time passes)

s1.ptxt: After checking fuel pressure, remove fuel pressure gauge.

attention1.ptxt: As fuel feed line is still under high fuel pressure, make sure to release fuel pressure according to the following procedures.

item.ptxt: Cover joint with rag and loosen joint nut slowly in order to release fuel pressure gradually.

s1.ptxt: Remove special tools from fuel delivery pipe and fuel feed hose.
Connect fuel feed hose to fuel delivery pipe and clamp it securely.
With engine OFF and ignition switch ON, check for fuel leaks.
